sense.gloss: unrelated, unconnected, irrelevant, indifferent, divorced from, having nothing to do with one, being foreign to one
without relations (esp. of a deceased person), having no surviving relatives
unrelated to the teachings of Buddha, unable to be saved by Buddha
dependent arising, doctrine that everything has a cause and there is nothing that arises out of nothing
hetu and prataya (direct causes and indirect conditions, which underlie the actions of all things)
breaking off relations (with), severing one's connections (with), breaking with (e.g. one's past)
forming a familial relationship (through adoption, marriage, etc.)
engawa, external corridor on the outer side of traditional Japanese houses
bone at the base of a fin (esp. of a flatfish), meat at the base of a fin
temple festival, fair, fete day, day related to a particular deity and thought to bring divine blessing to those who celebrate it
unconnected, weakly related, alien, far beyond (one's means, ability)
out of sight, in the background, unnoticed, under the veranda
piece of information that one has heard, I hear that ..., it is said that ...
connection (to a person, place, etc.), relation, affinity
fate, destiny (esp. as a mysterious force that binds two people together)
relationship (e.g. between two people), bond, link, connection
opportunity, chance (to meet someone and start a relationship)
pratyaya (indirect conditions, as opposed to direct causes)
something to rely on, aid, clue, way, means
edge (of a river, woods, etc.), shoulder (of a road)
rim, brim, hem, margin, fringe, selvage
fabric border (of a tatami mat, etc.), edging
cliff edge, edge of a precipice
reconciliation (with one's spouse, adopted child, etc.)
evil destiny or connection, unfortunate love
double marriage (in the same family), intermarriage

r_ele.r: せんとうじんちのぜんえん

sense.gloss: forward edge of the battle area

x: 袖振り合うも他生の縁

sdata.j: ↑金↑↓かね↓の↑切↑↓き↓れ↑目↑↓め↓が↑縁↑↓えん↓の↑切↑↓き↓れ↑目↑↓め↓。
sdata.e: The end of money is the end of love.

sdata.j: ↑縁組↑↓えんぐみ↓は↑天↑↓てん↓でなされる。
sdata.e: Marriage is made in heaven.

sdata.j: ↑縁↑↓えにし↓は↑異↑↓こと↓なもの。
sdata.e: Marriages are made in heaven.

sdata.j: ↑縁起↑↓えんぎ↓でもないこと↑言↑↓い↓うなよ。
sdata.e: It's bad luck to say that.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑縁↑↓えん↓の↑下↑↓した↓の↑力持↑↓ちからも↓ちだ。
sdata.e: He is an unsung hero.

sdata.j: どうやったら↑彼↑↓かれ↓と↑縁↑↓えにし↓を↑切↑↓き↓ることが↑出来↑↓でき↓るだろうか。
sdata.e: How can I get rid of him?

sdata.j: テーブルの↑縁↑↓えにし↓にグラスを↑置↑↓お↓かないで↑下↑↓くだ↓さい。
sdata.e: Don't put the glass near the edge of the table.

sdata.j: その↑道↑↓みち↓↑縁↑↓えにし↓には↑垣根↑↓かきね↓がある。
sdata.e: The path is bordered with hedges.

sdata.j: その↑後↑↓ご↓、カードを↑引↑↓ひ↓き↑抜↑↓ぬ↓いた。↑空気↑↓くうき↓はまったく↑入↑↓はい↓っていないので↑水↑↓みず↓は↑漏↑↓も↓れない。グラスの↑縁↑↓えにし↓はぴったりテーブルに↑接↑↓せっ↓しているから。
sdata.e: Then I slipped out the card. No water leaks out because no air can come in; the rim is too close to the table for that.

sdata.j: これはプラスチック↑製↑↓せい↓の↑額縁↑↓がくぶち↓です。
sdata.e: This is a picture frame made of plastic.

sdata.j: この↑金属↑↓きんぞく↓は↑錆↑↓さび↓とは↑無縁↑↓むえん↓です。
sdata.e: This metal is free of rust.

sdata.j: あの↑男↑↓おとこ↓はよくつまらぬことで↑誰↑↓だれ↓にでも↑因縁↑↓いんねん↓をつける。
sdata.e: He often uses the slightest thing as a pretext for a fight with anybody.

sdata.j: あの↑女↑↓おんな↓の↑子↑↓こ↓はお↑金↑↓かね↓に↑縁↑↓えにし↓がなく↑育↑↓そだ↓ったが、↑結婚↑↓けっこん↓してからは↑浪費↑↓ろうひ↓↑家↑↓か↓になった。
sdata.e: The girl had grown up without any money and when she married she became a spendthrift.

sdata.j: あいつに↑因縁↑↓いんねん↓を↑付↑↓つ↓けられた。
sdata.e: He made up a pretext for a fight with me.

sdata.j: ああいう↑男↑↓おとこ↓とは↑縁↑↓えん↓を↑切↑↓き↓れ。
sdata.e: Break off with such a man as that.

sdata.j: ↑７↑↓なな↓は↑縁起↑↓えんぎ↓のいい↑番号↑↓ばんごう↓だ。
sdata.e: Seven is a lucky number.

sdata.j: ↑４↑↓よん↓は↑日本語↑↓にほんご↓では↑縁起↑↓えんぎ↓の↑悪↑↓わる↓い↑数字↑↓すうじ↓だ。
sdata.e: Four is an unlucky number in Japanese.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑読↑↓よ↓んだ↑冒険↑↓ぼうけん↓↑談↑↓だん↓は↑実生活↑↓じっせいかつ↓とは↑縁遠↑↓えんどお↓い。
sdata.e: The adventures I read about are absent from my life.

sdata.j: ↑早↑↓はや↓くこの↑世↑↓よ↓を↑去↑↓さ↓ったのも↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓の↑因縁↑↓いんねん↓だ。
sdata.e: It was her fate to die young.

sdata.j: ↑男↑↓おとこ↓の↑子↑↓こ↓が↑縁石↑↓えんせき↓の↑方↑↓ほう↓へカートをゆっくり↑押↑↓お↓しやっている。
sdata.e: A boy is taking his sweet time pushing the cart toward the curb.

sdata.j: ↑当時↑↓とうじ↓、↑貧乏↑↓びんぼう↓は↑彼↑↓かれ↓らにとっては↑無縁↑↓むえん↓なものと↑思↑↓おも↓われた。
sdata.e: Poverty seemed to have nothing to do with them in those days.

sdata.j: ↑南↑↓みなみ↓↑諸島↑↓しょとう↓のコミュニティの↑中↑↓なか↓にはまったくの↑正↑↓せい↓↑反対↑↓はんたい↓の↑血縁↑↓けつえん↓↑関係↑↓かんけい↓のパターンが↑観察↑↓かんさつ↓されるであろう。
sdata.e: A diametrically opposed kinship pattern is to be observed among certain South Sea Island communities.

sdata.j: ↑猫↑↓ねこ↓はトラと↑近↑↓きん↓↑縁↑↓えにし↓である。
sdata.e: Cats are related to tigers.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓の↑肖像↑↓しょうぞう↓↑画↑↓が↓は↑装飾↑↓そうしょく↓の↑施↑↓ほどこ↓された↑額縁↑↓がくぶち↓にはめられた。
sdata.e: His portrait was mounted in the fancy frame.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓はスージーと↑縁↑↓えにし↓を↑切↑↓き↓った。
sdata.e: He has done with Susie.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓はその↑一族↑↓いちぞく↓に↑縁↑↓えにし↓がある。
sdata.e: He is related to the family.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓はその↑事件↑↓じけん↓とまったく↑無縁↑↓むえん↓ではない。
sdata.e: He is involved in the case a little.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑街頭↑↓がいとう↓で↑買↑↓か↓った↑絵↑↓え↓を↑額縁↑↓がくぶち↓に↑入↑↓い↓れた。
sdata.e: He framed the picture he had bought on the street.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓らは↑水瓶↑↓みずがめ↓を↑縁↑↓ふち↓まで↑一↑↓いっ↓↑杯↑↓ぱい↓にした。
sdata.e: So they filled them to the brim.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑随分↑↓ずいぶん↓↑前↑↓まえ↓に↑家族↑↓かぞく↓と↑縁↑↓えにし↓を↑切↑↓き↓った。
sdata.e: She broke with her family long ago.
